#believerbc  This chapter was very interesting! It casts an interesting tone for the story and I instantly want to read more! I'm getting a Greek god vibe  but it's possible you have different gods in mind. I tend to think the chapter was a little short and I was disappointed there was so little. Overall  I think the story has a lot of potential! Good job!

#believerbc I love the questions! It really brings rhythm and mystery into the book. However  usually God is only capitalized if there is One God. If there is more than one  usually it is just  a god. So How do you kill a god?

Author: JustBEfreEtoLivE
Text Replies: #believerbc  This was a very good beginning. A god for a god  an era for an era. I don't know why  but I loved it.

Author: MadhavaPriyaa
Text Replies: #leisurely This was fantastic! Your grammar is remarkable  and the concept of this story is intriguing. The way you have written the Gods  and their connection with the elements is amazing. It reminded me of Greek mythology  what with the comparison to Zeus  Poseidon and Hades  as well as Persephone (I am guessing) and the Goddess of Snow? Or is it Aphrodite?

Author: secretswansong
Text Replies: This is really good and visually appealing  even if I don't really like chapters with casts of characters bc I feel like they're information dumps and I have difficulty keeping track of the characters. (But that's just me.) I suggest that as you write  you keep track of your world building. Like don't explain/describe too much at the beginning / first five or so chapters of your story. Make sure to split paragraphs and sentences if necessary. Start with surface and/or most important details and keep them concise because I found that writers usually fall into this trap:  You're braver now that Crabbe and Goyle are with you." Crabbe and Goyle glared at Harry. "I'd take you anytime on my own. Up for a wizard's duel?" Malfoy drawled. I might've learnt that I was a wizard just a month ago  but I wasn't so ignorant now. A wizard's duel is when blah blah blah really long description here"

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: Hiya!  I'm a big reader of high fantasy and some of the inspirations you listed for this story are some of my favorite books so I thought to check this out! Being honest  I really like the lore you've established here (just ask my friends  I'm a sucker for mythology!) And from reading this  it really shows that you've put alot into this world and how all these gods  goddesses and Houses fit into it all. You also really used text alignment to your advantage and I think it really fit the tone you were trying to convey. However  I have to say while the writing itself was fine  the overall feel of this opening felt...clunky.   "This is the story Queen who no longer feared death..of a King who helped her laugh again...." (I'm paraphrasing here  please bear with me.)  It's alot of telling versus showing and then you have a huge shift in tone. Almost like you went from pitching the story to the readers to going to some scene where X character is hearing stories around a campfire. It's a pretty sharp contrast and it doesn't go very well together in my opinion. I think you'd really benefit from getting rid of "This is the story of a queen" bit and just leaving this prologue as the conversation between the unknown characters about the world and the gods and goddesses who inhabit it.  So overall  I'm not super sold on this prolouge as it is  but your lore is so detailed that I think I'm going to move on and see what happens next.   Write on! :)

Author: 6dream
Text Replies: #BelieverBC   This was one of the best prologue I.ve ever read in my entire life. How you shaped the conversations into a powerful telling of the history of the whole planets. It was so new seeing prologues like this. Where everything is cleared up in such a simple yet informative way. If you had wrote this history in the form of paragraphs and telling it would've been too much information and too heavy for a prologue. But  this was very clever.  I so enjoyed the story behind their replies. It was very interesting  very intriguing. And I couldn't help but feel eager.   The ending too was so powerful  holding strong meanings behind it and I love these kind of cliffhangers.  Well done!

Author: jackiel2004
Text Replies: #BelieverBC  It must've taken you forever to plan this out and create the world of Endollon. I'm amazed by how you put all of this together and created all of these names  characters  storylines  etc. I know I would never have the patience to do what you did with this story. It's definitely going somewhere because this is not only super creative  but I love how this is written. It doesn't get boring like many other books usually do. There's something about your writing style that I love  and I can't figure out what it is. This is amazing!

#believerbc  Let me just say  I am in awe. I can tell how much plotting  thinking  and connecting you had to do to create this world. Fantasy is one of the hardest genre's to write because you have to create an entirely new world with entirely different customs  mannerisms  people  animals  and ecosystem  but I feel you are nailing it. This is just my personal opinion  but i think it might be more organic if you didn't pose this as like an extra  history of the world kind of thing. I think some people might chalk it up to be something that's optional and jump into the next chapter  but I'm guessing this will be important info later. I know you already have a prologue   which means you can't have another  but I would like to suggest  that you make this a chapter  rather than an informational little tidbit before the book. The writing is already in sort of a cinematic style  so you could always make it into this omnipotent narrator and remove the first sentence. Take it or leave it. This is just something I wanted to point out. Otherwise  everything is great. I love the voice of your writing.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: I like this chapter a lot more than I liked the prolouge. The overall tone of this chapter was way more consistent and read a lot more smoothly as a result. I really liked the eerie atmosphere you created with the blood ritual; it definitely felt taboo and creepy (and I say that in the best way possible!) And though I don't know the name of this character who was narrating  whoever she was  I think she was established very well. Her tone struck me as very petulant  wanting something she wasn't fit to have and insisting she was owed it  even after she had been denied because some things just can't happen.  I'm definitely getting the idea that she might become a villain in this story after this failed encounter with the shade and the denied wish.   That aside however  I do have a note regarding the writing of this chapter. At times " your prose became a bit too purple (another way to say it got overly descriptive) and really took away from what this could've been.  I saw this most at the opening here:  ""The clock struck twelve"  the planets shifted " the stars exchanged...my blue eyes were hazy..."" Your word choice for this section was nicely varied and certainly descriptive" " but it was a lot of description in a really short amount of time. I think cutting some of it out would help focus on the chapter on the main event (the interaction with the shade) alot more and really throw the reader in head first.  For example: ""The clock struck twelve and I watched as wisps of coal black smoke curled around my hands as the knives slit my wrists. Blood splattered onto the mirror in front of me" " the candles began to dim as I counted back from thirteen....""  I'd hope you'd have better word choice than I did in the above"  but I hope my point comes across either way. We're getting right into the ritual then  rather than taking our time.  Also  last thing  at the end you have single sentences as full paragraphs " ""This was not supposed to happen"  I had to run " the corridor was empty..."""

Author: The-Betrayed
Text Replies: #OnlyVoraciousReader  Wonderful!  Superb!  The ending hook was done nicely and will keep the readers hooked and waiting for the next chapter.  It's a very well-written chapter  with good characterization. You have perfected the trick of writing chapters by writing well-sized chapters as most of the wattpaders are usually scrolling on their phones.   They prefer short chapters of 1500-2000 words.   Keep it short and sweet.   Well written.   Your description was well done and it makes the reader feel like he is actually experiencing the story.   Usually  authors choke the readers with too much information  but you are writing perfectly and giving the info gradually.   Excellent opener  though. Very hooking. A well-written chapter  with good characterization  I did not spot any grammar mistakes  but in case I did not spot them  I would recommend using a grammar-checker like Grammarly to smooth out the wrinkles.   It is a good thing that you did not use a lot of A/N in the first chapter  it deters people off from the topic. You have used the Ch1 well  most people misuse the Ch1 or simply do not know how to use it well. they give too much or too less info in one stroke.   I liked the way you end the chapter  it leaves the reader hungry for more.  Thank You.  Regards  OnlyVoraciousReader

Author: Davrielle
Text Replies: #BelieverBC  Overall the chapter was  well written. However I did have some issues with it  and I'll explain the the best that I can. First  as a prologue  it feels more like a chapter one. A prologue should be shorter  so I would reconsider the titling of this piece. Second  you use a lot of suddenly  and thens in the narrative. The problem with using words like And then  or suddenly  is that it takes away from the immediacy of the scene. We are taken away from the story by thinking of the word suddenly " so it becomes something that kind of weakens the narrative. In dialogue I can see it working. We say ""all of a sudden"" a lot"  so keep that in mind too.   I also feel that there is too much about the main character and the shade. Like I feel that there's being too much thrown in a prologue. I really feel like if you want to worldbuild Endollon  you should focus on the Regnants in the following chapter and leave world building out of the prologue (if you decide to keep it as a prologue). Prologues should be teasers  and I feel that there is just too much info in this. I know I said that already  but it's something that I think could be worked on for this prologue.    Now what I liked a lot was the way you handled most of the descriptions. Nothing was lacking in meat  and the voice was pretty strong all the way through  so I compliment that and your ability to continue writing with precise lines. There was the line I loved the most and it was the dialogue with the shade. For some reason I felt the shade being raspy voiced  and when I read that it had a raspy voice  I wondered why I felt like that. I noticed that the shade needs more description of raspy stuff  but I feel like thatmight have been why since it's shadowy and almost ghost like.   Overall this is an enjoyable read  even if it was a little heavy on the detail for a prologue.

Text Replies: This is a good scene  even just getting told "there's nothing more we can do  you're gonna die" Edna still has the compassion to take pity on a little girl trying to make some money with homemade amulets.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: I think you can cut this bit here  you've already said she's sad  saying it again is overkill.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: I think you could remove this line and just leave it at "by those standards  I was the poorest person I knew". It's establishing the same fact and doing so in a way that feels more emotional I think.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: This is a really good paragraph. Even with all the success she's had  Enda still has regrets and I think including them is a really good portrayal of how death affects people-they really start thinking of what matters versus material possessions.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: I'd combine this line with the four beneath it  having them standalone really breaks up the flow of the writing. Having them together makes it feel more like Edna is reflecting on her impending death.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: I'd remove this line  it's already established that her death is imminent (once and for all is a pretty powerful statement on its own). Having this just feels really redundant to me.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: Now this might be a good place to have that line about her being unable to see her beauty and how it's superficial anyways. It'd feel a lot more natural here as she's reflecting on how she's so young and has so much ahead of her and is facing this reality of dying.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: I'd combine these doctor introductions into one paragraph. Groups the topic a little more.

Author: Jamie-Michelle
Text Replies: This line doesn't make much sense to me  how does her voice being broken lead into beauty? It doesn't strike me as a natural thought process. Might want to relocate the line "despite the beauty" bit to a better place where t might feel like a more natural introduction.

Author: Pennywithaney
Text Replies: I totally think the little girl was a test. Like the beggar woman from Beauty and the Beast or maybe something similar to Hestia from Greek Mythology (like the goddess of the Hearth or something. Not sure why I'm getting that vibe  but I am).  And as for babbling/disappearing  I have one word: magic. Same thing for how the people got into her penthouse.  And the talk of the future queen means basically that Edna is destined for greatness which is great because Edna is great. I love her character. She seems honest and strong. Plus  I'm interested in seeing how she develops.  On another note: I thought it was cool how you started the story off in New York. It was a nice addition especially since most books of this ilk (i.e. Three Dark Crowns  A Song of Ice and Fire  The Crown  etc.) start off in the high-fantasy world of who knows where.   Not that there's anything wrong with that  of course. It just adds to the whole feeling I'm getting from this book.   A nice cool breath of fresh air. A brilliant breath of fresh air.   I can't wait to read more!

Text Replies: #believerbc  AHHHHHH! I love this so much! Your writing is just mesmerizing. Anywhoo  Edna is a very complex and interesting character. She started out with not much-being an orphan and all-and built herself up. Yet  she still cares about her community. The girl with the necklaces seems pretty sketch  and I feel like she has something to do with these mysterious people. Your description was on point. Not too little not too much. Your dialogue is also very natural " but I feel almost overwhelmed by the amount of ""-"" you use. I agree they are a helpful tool"  but if they are used to much when they are not really needed  it feels a bit repetitive. Again this is the super picky part of me! üòÇ Amazing job! Very excited to read more! üëåüèΩ

Author: aishafanfiction
Text Replies: #believerbc  Firstly  someone commented to me saying I was too 'harsh'  " I need to point out that I'm a brutally honest person and majority of the club knows so I don't usually like to keep repeating myself~  I'm pretty sure that if your talking it should be ""Hey" " "" She smiled at him before continuing" " ""I'm excited to see you.""  There should be a capital letter even if it's a continuation of the previous sentence"  it looks much more neater like this and professional books have this in their book dialogues. I'm a bit surprised to see someone doing their research on actual facts and knowledge. There are very few authors that would think twice before putting a chapter out in public without getting everything confirmed first. I commend you on that!   I believe there were quite a number of questions that could easily just be placed in one or two dialogues rather than separating them because it not only takes up a lot of space but it makes the story quite draggy if there were too many dialogues.  I didn't feel as if the descriptions here hit my satisfaction  I'm more of a expressive kind of writer and reader however  it was good enough to help readers visualise the scenario!

Author: Spruce_Goose
Text Replies: #believerbc  Again  this is a fantastic chapter! It holds enough emotional and curiosity to hold the reader's attention which is really great! The description is amazing and the emotion you convey in the hospital is great.  Again  as I pointed out  I do have an issue with the huge dialogue paragraphs. When it's being read on a computer screen  it's quite hard to read through the whole thing  particularly as there is a lack of dialogue tags. It makes it impossible to distinguish who is saying what. I would suggest separating it out more so that it is easy on the reader's eyes.  Also  the information dump is a little bit of an issue. We find out a lot about the character and it is hard to process it all and remember every little detail. You could try filtering all this information throughout the book rather than just unloading it as has been done here. That way it'll be easier to read and process everything.  This is a good start  though!

Author: Spruce_Goose
Text Replies: #believerbc  This is one of the things I pointed out in my previous comment  the huge paragraphs with dialogue. Due to the lack of dialogue  it is really hard to tell who's speaking when and what's going on. Online  it messes with your eyes a little  I would suggest separating this out.

Text Replies: #believerbc  I love how you're able to convey emotion throughout this chapter. Once again  you did a great job with the descriptions. Author: breakingbones98
Text Replies: #believerbc  I want to start this off by saying I really enjoyed this chapter. The dialogue was very smooth and the whole chapter has really nice pacing. It didn't feel rushed or too slow.  That being said  some parts seemed very confusing at parts. A lot of characters  complete with full names and descriptions were thrown at once. I had to scroll up to remember who was who a few times. It also seemed a bit jarring to have a character named Robin Williams  considering he was a big public figure.  There was also a few gramatical type issues that took away from the story. You referred to Robin as Robbins at one point " which an s at the end usually is reserved for a last name. The phrasing of ""Vienna let go of the leash on her pet poodle" " running over to wrap her arms around me"" implies that the poodle wrapped it's arms around Edna. Terrifying.   But"  I really did enjoy the characters and the use of repetition of the things she could never do again.

Text Replies: #believerbc  wonderful! your dialogue is very easy to read and realistic at the same time ... I like how characters are "cut off" by other characters  like in real life :P

Author: Davrielle
Text Replies: #BelieverBC   In the first chapter  I like the conversation she has with Dr. Williams  but it feels like there should be more of a transition from introduction of Edna to Robin Williams  who I can't help but imagine as Robin Williams lol. The scene between her and the doctor is a very good one  and makes me wonder more about the doctor. Something tells me he might have a bigger role  but who knows. The last part of the chapter I liked the best  to be honest. It seems to get right into the meat of the story and makes you wonder what is going on with Edna and how those mysterious men got into her house. Also find it funny that a 28 year old reluctant socialite won a Pulitzer. It is kind of reminiscent of Edith Wharton in some ways  since she won the Pulitzer in '21 for The Age of Innocence (my fav lol). Overall  I wonder where the story is going now and it has been a very enjoyable read!

During the fight  it was like imagining the characters' movements with very little surroundings  and the surroundings that were there were from my imagination. Things like tables and chairs are important to mention during action scenes so we know how much space they have to move around.

Author: MikaelaMikhail
Text Replies: I got confused with the dialogues in the first part  especially when they were squabbling and all. I think you need to clearly define who is talking. But other than that  I can see that you put a lot of effort in this! Yes  I've already read the prologue (it was fantastic btw. Very original. How do you kill a God? I will always remember this. A God for a God. Geez  I'm already getting goosebumps from that) and also your author's note (inspirational!) Okay so we have Edna  a modern Manhattan City elite genius and philantropist suddenly clashing with people who don't seem to be from the same world  what with their weird long names and titles. Okay so my theory that this was the start of her afterlife is debunked. Sad. Anyways  I'm just...lol cos here she is...literally dying of heart failure and these people are bantering right in front of her. And I think it's pretty obvious that she's having problems with her health/heart with her gasping and struggling so she shouldn't be surprised that Eric knows about her condition. Okay now another theory. Eric may be a potential lover to Edna right? Haha. Or am I wrong. But anyways  the ending is appropriate with a cliffhanger cos now we know that Edna's condition is actually 'made' and the only reason it's still working despite the ventricle practically dangling in the open is because she's....connected to the Gods/is a God? And that there is a cure... and somehow  I don't know if it's intended or how you manage to do it  but I imagine the new characters to have a British accent? Lol. Btw  the chapters are just nice in length so it's easy to read. Nice work!   #believerbc

Author: lllumos
Text Replies: I love the story and the plot  however  at the beginning " in the chapter called ""history has its eyes on you"" - I felt that there were too many information being scattered all at once about the different races that has emerged. And about the family in general.   Fortunately"  It's not that hard to grasp the basic content about the lord of the sky and mother earth - having six children  and their two children -Cosmo and Titania - eventually becoming the rulers when the fall.  But  maybe it would be a good idea to draw a family tree   including ones for the different houses and show how they are linked together- so that the readers could look back on it in order to get a clearer understanding of the characters and the story.  It would be so much easier to get a snapshot view of it- if we ever do need a reference.   Sorry for the super long comment. I hope that I made sense when I typed this all in.   ( it's just an idea )   Overall   I'm enjoying this book üíô I like it.

Author: rubyruins
Text Replies: @Tophie_Star  Wow  you really do know her quite well  I feel so glad!üòá Well  you are absolutely right. Edwina is her own person  and she's used to power because she's actually had nothing in the start and she built it up herself - let me clarify with a bit of backstory here?   When Asteria died  well  Elodie too had died. Edwina's father  Lucius was Lord of Dracnesse but he was sentenced to fifty years of imprisonment. Both her parents gone. At the same time  Aidon had his Trials. Which left just Edwina and very small baby  Amphitrite  whom she had no idea how to raise. Oh  and she had half a huge river to defend  along with the combined strength of the really pissed off Valmonts and the greedy Everlys who wanted her part of the Derwent. That was one of the most trying times of her life  and those ghosts never left her. At all.  That's the reason why she feels very  very personal about her family. It's because she's known what it feels to live without them  and she knows how much precious your loved ones can be. Cosmo knew that fully well  and it forced him to threaten her. Because more or less  yes  Edwina is her own person  and she hates it when someone tells her what to do. She lives on her terms. She's seen injustice for too long  especially with the females  always considered the weaker sex in their world. So she tries harder and harder to fight  and it's one of the biggest lost wars of her life when she finally agrees to marry Tristan. Because it bends her to three men's will - her father  Cosmo  and Tristan himself. Besides  as a wife  she'd now have to move from Dracnesse and stay in Tristan's Castle in Stormholt.   And that is the same place where her mother's killer resides too.

Author: Imperfetto_Tesoro
Text Replies: This comment may be offensive. Girl let me tell you something! My first three chapters got so much crap the first time I tried my hand in this writing my own work  someone in a bookclub went as far as downright saying she does not like the chapter at all and kept inlining every single flaw. Of course I delete them because that type of negative energy I do not need. Then another set of people were like I should do this and that you know what I did? I took all those crappy opinions and wore them like a freaking armor  I took a few deep breaths and rant to a few good friends. I believed in my story and I just said f*ck it! Went back and improved my chapters that was up and continued to write and today that same crappy book is a multi time award winner! It started out being featured in top 20s  then I reedited and we started winning third places  went back and reedited and we moved to second place! And I believe so much in my story and felt it can do better  I started rewriting that shit. It's been a rough road to where we are now but the challenges made us where we are now. So my advice! Take deep breaths and rant out all your emotions  then go back to the drawing broad with a big f*ck it and WRITE if you believe in your characters WRITE! Don't let them stop you and bring you down!

Author: DelhiBelly
Text Replies: I have been on Wattpad since 2015 but my bio says that I joined in June 2017. There's a reason behind it.  Every time someone critiqued my works and saying that it's absolute rubbish  it would always get to my head. I now know that you really shouldn't take it to heart and just plough through it but back then  I didn't. I would start doubting my novels and would eventually delete my account and make another account to post a new  better story. I have made many accounts because of this and this account is the eleventh one (crazy  right?). But now I realise that I shouldn't take it so hard. Haters gonna hate  after all  but your work will still be truly spectacular.

Author: gulabjamuns
Text Replies: Aw honey  I haven't read it yet  but I think your book seems awesome! It's great that you're trying to break cliches " and the ""keeping the readers afraid of the mc"" part is not only a good way to hook your readers"  it's actually different from other books! Only a few books keep you genuinely worried about the characters (ASOIAF)  but in most of them  you're sure they're gonna come out victorious.  I totally get that thing about being down because of a review. I got one for my story Up  Up and Away once and even though most of it was still in a positive light  the negative parts hit me HARD. They were things I had never stopped to consider. Although I was (and still am) thankful to the reviewer  I began to question why on earth I was even bothering to write in the first place. I began to think that I was the worst writer on the face of the planet  and I was writing the most cringeworthy book of all time. What I decided from that was to not ask for my book to be properly reviewed until after I completed it. That way  I wouldn't break down half-way through and sit in mourning for the death of my confidence. But after a while  most (not all  I guess) of the insecurity wore off  and I felt more confident about writing. And the encouragement of my friends really helped too. If your readers think your work is good  if they like it  then that does half the trick!   Although it's important to actually like what you write  I think it's also natural for you to question parts of your book. Being blind to your own flaws can't possibly be of any help  so it's a good thing if you know where you're going wrong! That way  you can improve. (And not become full of yourself by thinking you've written the best book in the whole wide world.)   As your friend  all my support is with you. I hope you will be able to see your book in good light again soon. ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

Author: GlaireMannon
Text Replies: This comment may be offensive. You know I love this book. It's wonderful it really is  the writing is well done and it's clear that you've thought the story out and have a direction that this is all going in but ; I don't think any of these scenes with the royalty have been properly thought out. Edwina is Queen regnant no matter if they like her or not  no matter if they want money or into her pants her word is law. The fact that these same people can continue to disrespect her  harass her and try to kill her MULTIPLE times WITHOUT punishment is completely unacceptable and amazing to me that NO ONE does anything about this! You could argue that she broke his hand or whatever just happened but that is not what the punishment should be for someone trying to kill THE QUEEN in her own home. These people should be locked away or tied to a rock so their insides can be pecked out by birds for eternity but they should not be given warning after warning without anything being done. Same with Tristan. The scene where he rescues the young girls is insane! A man should NOT be able to WHIP THE KING ACROSS THE FACE and continue breathing! By even disobeying direct orders from him should equal some kind of punishment if not death equal to death. I'm sorry if this seems rude but every time I read about these people calling their QUEEN wench or harlot or trying to kill her AGAIN it just takes me out of the story. I can't imagine that they just let these horrific people continue on with their wicked lives as if they had half as much power as Tristan and Edwina do. I don't know what kind of monarchy these people are running but it clearly isn't effective.

Author: MiriamCortinovis
Text Replies: Hello there! Since you've expressed the desire of improving  so I've read this far and now I'm ready to give you a first opinion. You already know what I think of the introduction chapter  so I will focus more on the following two. The plot per se is very unique  so is the world you created and its system. I found the Monarch Trials interesting and the magic the gods wield certainly have potential. Having said that  I'm not sure I'm going to continue your story - here's why. The writing style had appropriate diction and proper grammar  however  I personally found it meagre  almost like a script  with plenty of well-constructed dialogue but no real narrative. Perhaps it was because of the need to explain a lot of stuff (I'lll come back to that)  but to me it felt fast and rushed. It caused  therefore  a lot of confusion in my head  specially with the character  which I wasn't able to identify. Expect for Edna  since it's her point of view  I have only blurry ideas of the other characters mentioned. They are reduced to their names  while I don't have an idea of how they look like  how they act  and what their personality is like. Your way of explaining background is clear and neat  however  I felt that it was definitely too much  to the point I personally don't have a real input to jump and read the next chapter. In many ways  it also felt obvious. I expected she was going to be a god  and that they'd put her on Earth for her protection. Again  the world you created and its players have tons of potential  which I envy  but they are not expressed to their fullest  thus  sounding to me both chaotic and simplistic. Last but not least  in terms of emotions  I personally didn't feel attached to Edna  in particular to her resistance to drink the medicine and come back to her real world. Mostly  it was because I didn't perceive the fifteen years she mentions  didn't feel the attachment she had to her life  despite the first chapter (which  if I may say  kind of (continues)

Author: X_marks_the_0
Text Replies: Try to use less adverbs during dialogue tags. Keep them simple (i.e. he said  she said) so that the action flows. Especially during an information bomb  it's best not to get too caught up on something as benign as a few little words. Otherwise it's great üëç üòä  The one part eating me alive was her heart condition. If it was as bad as the doctors said it was  she wouldn't be allowed to do any strenuous activity. So the prolonged scene in the second chapter where everyone is arguing and Edna has a gun is really stretching it. She would have had problems throughout the whole scene. When the first guy (blondie I believe  lol) appears out of nowhere  that would have given her an awful start.   Plus  holding a gun with the intent to shoot would skyrocket a heart rate. Not sure how much shooting experience you've had  but a gun is a very explosive weapon. A lot can go wrong  especially at such close range. Even if she's been trained to use it  that doesn't change the fight or flight response she would be having in the moment. The movies make it seem like nothing to fire away  but that's far from the reality.  ~ I really loved the opening line. I've done a script with that same first part spoken by Edna  and it really brought a lot back for me to read that. Probably not what you were going for  but I thought I'd share  cause it stuck with me through all 3 chapters. The rest of the dialogue was also quite good  might I say. It's that first line though that did me in!  #bbc

Author: JasmanianDevil27
Text Replies: #Leisurely  So  in a normal  paper book " your paragraphs would be like:  Words      New paragraph. ""Blah"  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah  blah " blah."" They think words or make an action.      Someone else starts talking.      Other person responds.  A new setting/topic starts. For example they went to sleep and woke up but the chapter isn't over so you skip a line.      Someone says good morning.      They respond.  But on wattpad"  it often autocorrects your indentations and when you want to comment it will ignore the place where you went down to the next line and put it at the place where you next skip a line. Then  you have this huge block of texts and all the comments get thrown in the same spot.  So typically on wattpad you skip a line instead of just dropping down one.  Not: Blah blah. Blah  blah.  Instead: Blah  blah.  Blah  blah.

Author: prosejoyce
Text Replies: I have a theory!   You see  there were things that were going awfully wrong throughout the last few chapters  starting with when Edwina kissed Eric.   No..   It started when she first saw the Titaness. Ever since then  strange things have been happening. I think that it's because of their presence. Because the only person who knows that they're there is Edwina  so they have everyone turn against her.   Aidon is affected. In the previous chapters  we see how he is with Edwina; he loves her. This isn't how he'd act..   Her sister  Amphitrie  is affected. Llewellyn was affected. Eric. Basically everyone  with the exception of the Rotavelles  because they were always *sshats.   Aidon isn't the one who wants the Cube; the Titans do. It's a whole ploy  to get it and destroy all the gods/goddesses. And they started it  by turning them all on their Queen. They made her feel like an outcast  a murderer.  Plus  she's the only one of them who can figure out how to open the Cube. I refuse to believe that they're all acting like assholes  because she killed the triplets.   Everyone knows Edwina by now and her love for Amphitrite  so they could've easily put down that bullsh*t. Something's affecting them.  I know so..

Great job!

Author: PRXSLEYS
Text Replies: This book. This book is perhaps one of the few books to make me cry. The characters  the world building and the development is outlined and written so flawlessly that I couldn't help but physically&emotionally ùòßùò¶ùò¶ùò≠ these emotions and I can see them as real living souls who got lost in a dark  twisting  vicious storm that you have created. I loved Edwina's bravery and sense of unbelievable power and her need to put others before her own. Author: SensuousAllure
Text Replies: God. I'm so sad to see this book over honestly. For months I had been going through some stuff and finally decided to get Wattpad again. I'll never forget the day I was looking through the tags Fantasy and found this piece of treasure. I put it in my library  just knowing I had to keep it there and read it. The moment I started to read it  I was completely hooked. Throughout the chapters you made me laugh  cry  (well almost. I was out in public so held back during most chapters) and made me want to write something like this. But unfortunately  as you know I quit writing. But you made me realize how much I miss and loved writing. Also  at the end of all the chapters I remembered that life doesn't all give us a happy ending.   When I say it's hard for me to read sometimes  it definitely is. Sometimes if I'm not interested enough my mind wanders  and I don't really focus on the story. But this  of course I did. From start to finish   . So I want to thank you. Thank you so much for creating this beautiful work of Art. Thank you for giving me inspiration when I least expected it  and thank you for giving me hope and strength when it was most needed. Edwina taught me a lot  but if anything she taught me to be strong and fight  because a Queen NEVER goes down without a fight.

There was a school club that I really wanted to join and I tried really hard on my application  interview  essay  and recommendation letters but in the end  I didn't get in but all the popular people  even the ones that did nothing  all got in. I was really sad and hurt and angry at first  but now I've gotten to do so much more and I've experienced so many amazing things I couldn't have done before. I believe everything happens for a reason and this book is so amazing I finished it in two days and I truly believe that you will definitely win next year. You're so inspiring and talented and I'm a huge fan of yours. This is definitely one of my absolute favorite books on wattpad and in general. It's definitely going in all my libraries! I love your writing style  your amazing plots  the twists and turns   the betrayals  the character development  all the GOT references  and literally every single thing! I love this book so much and I'm so grateful I read it! You're an awesome reader and you have a huge fanbase by your side the whole time! With that said  I know you must be busy lately but I hope you can update soon! I'm really excited and I know anything you write will be amazing!  Best of luck for the future and lots of love! - Dani

Author: Question_AUTHORITY
Text Replies: I have waited a long  long time to write this comment.  From the very first sentence  your story enticed me. You claim that the villains are mere shadows of their potential  but I find them more solid than the phone in my hand. The motivations  the thoughts  the ideals that each character holds close to them make them so distinct  such an individual entity  that it shocked me. The pain that I felt when Tristan died was shocking. The silent sobbing was shocking. The sheer force of your words nearly bowled me over. Hours and hours  I have spent pouring over your work. You point out the flaws  but I want to bring to light the beautiful strengths that it has. The words themselves work alongside you. The imagery is stronger than a Robert Frost poem.  When you doubt yourself  just know that there are people like me. People who are devoted  who would bow down to the crown of words that you wear proudly.

DAMN I WROTE A WHOLE ASS ESSAY üò≠üò≠

I've been holding this off for a minute now and finally imma say it.  I am not worthy to be reading this book for free. this story  the characters  the feeling  the LIFE you gave to this story is absolutely stunning. I'll be honest and say that the first time I saw this book  I didn't know whether or not to read it but after finally going through every chapter and word that you laid out for your readers? it was so f≈´cking worth it. honestly  I feel as though you did an amazing job with this book. little as you may say you did with this story  I will say you did way more than you give yourself credit for. yes  you could have changed the tides for many of your characters and given them a bit more of what they all individually lacked but at the end of the day  you created a universe filled with awe and wonder. and that's what authors like me aspire to do with their own works. create a space where everything comes to life. and you did that.  so all I have to really say is  thank you. thank you for allowing me to read this beautiful masterpiece you call Crown of Glass. thank you for allowing so many of us to read this book for free. and if you EVER decide to publish this  lord knows I'll be so happy to see this book out in the world but I'll also be happy to purchase it. ‚ù§Ô∏è

I'm actually fine with no sequel honestly. if anything  this ending to the book made me happy. this entire story alone made me extremely happy to even be able to read this. if at one point you do feel that you need a sequel to this  then please go ahead. but just like every author I've ever read from  allow for your characters to rest. if they're not speaking or wide awake  let them rest. as should you.

Author: burgundoise
Text Replies: Oh. My. Bleeding. Goodness. Where do I begin? I binge-read this whole book over the span of about 8 hours. And I legitimately feel like my life has changed. Ellis  you have left a lasting impact on every single one of your readers. I experience shock  I cried  I got horny (I need to go find some holy water)  I laughed. I laughed maniacally at 3 in the morning. I sobbed at 3 in the evening. You have given me so much life with this book. I admire every drop of sweat  blood and tears that you put into this book. All the details... they are glorious. Every inch of your pages are glorious. Every bit of your calloused fingers and minute if your screentime is glorious. It is wicked  it is wild  and most of all  you glorious goddess of a writer  it is wonderful. Thank you for giving us Crown and Glass. I pray that I shall be plucking this book off my shelf to read to my children  nestled between the works if Mary Shelley and Shakespeare. I pray that box office records are broken with movies inspired by this book. I pray that the actors that portray these characters break Oscar records. I pray that your name goes down in history  and is lauded in Harvard classrooms. Ellis  you have a God-given gift. Thank you for giving us a glimpse of it.

Author: NConstantina
Text Replies: In regret  blooms growth.  I think in some beautiful  sadistic way  as you are broken down like glass  you are built up stronger than steel until you finally break  or can be broken anymore. This book has a been wonderful ride from start to finish  no matter the flaws. Perhaps  as you quote later in this epilogue  you are most intimate with this book. Meaning you see all its flaws.  Despite those flaws  this book is still incredible. Its still a wonder of neatly tied up plot threads and terrifying villains who kill hundreds with a snap. Its a spectacle of bloody poetry that grabs the reader and doesn't let go. I know I certainly couldn't let go.  Know  that no matter what you decide to do with CoG  whether rewrite it or leave for the internet trolls  that your book has changed me as a person  and as a writer.  Thank you for that. ‚ù§Ô∏è

Author: queenlythefirst
Text Replies: I remember  a year ago I think  one of my English teachers asked us to write an persuasive essay to convince people to get an app or product. I chose Wattpad  and more specifically  this story. It has most of my favourite things rolled into one  mythology  reincarnation  gods  magic (dark magic too)  medieval feudal society and an immersive storytelling that sucked me into the world. I don't remember ever getting it back  but I did get into the English Lit class which was apparently very selective  so there you go. So for all of this  two years of intrigue  plot twists and that damn slow burn  I can safely say  from the bottom of my heart  thank you so  so much.

Text Replies: I LOVE YOU TOOOOOO. Never had I ever imagined this book would be such a major part of me when I started reading it. Your writing was what called up to me but now it's so much more than that. Your characters have depth  your plot is so twisted and complex and your descriptions always bring tears to my eyes. You made me feel absolute pain  ground shaking  world breaking despair. You really are a writer and Crown of Glass is nothing but a master piece. I'm so proud of all of this  the words you pulled together to make such amazingly beautiful chapters. I had yet to find such a book that can make me feel so lost and full within the same chapter. It speaks of hope and endless time. And I love it  every crevice of it. Thank you Ellis  thank you.
